results.title: Digestion of food
results.brief_description: A summary of the digestive process, including the following aspects: the function of the mouth; stomach, and small intestine; secretions and enzymes - the systems affected and the products formed; reactions, digestive movements, and their control (recorded by microphotography); the relation of the circulatory and nervous systems to the digestive process; motility of the digestive tract - normal movements, hypermotility, inhibition, hunger contractions, segmentations, peristalsis and anti-peristalsis; and motility of the intestinal villi.

results.title: Digestion in our bodies
results.brief_description: The steps in the digestive process and the functions of the main organs. How and why food must be digested before the body can use it. Why correct eating attitudes and habits are important. Uses X-ray techniques and simple diagrams.

results.title: Dig a million, make a million
results.creator_credit: Tom Haydon and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: Reconstructs the financing and business organisation behind the development of the Mount Tom Price iron mine and the associated industry. Shows the role of overseas capital and enterprise in the exploitation of the resources.

results.title: Diffusion and osmosis
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: A study of diffusion as it takes place in living cells. Uses photomicrography, time-lapse photography, simple laboratory demonstrations, and models to explain diffusion and to clarify how a selectively permeable membrane functions. Demonstrates osmosis, the diffusion of water through a selectively permeable membrane, and includes practical examples of diffusion and osmosis.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Charles L. Finance and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: Diffusion and osmosis
results.brief_description: Illustrates the diffusion of gases and liquids, Show the selective action of the semi-permeable membrane. Demonstrates the effects of osmosis. Defines relevant terms such as permeability and turgor.

results.title: Different with dignity
results.brief_description: In five separate episodes, this film explores the various perceptions of male and female roles within a marriage. After each episode, a question is raised for further class discussion on everything from sexual stereotypes to what it means to be a good parent. Cast includes Richard Jackal, Jeffrey Hunter and Vera Miles.

results.title: Different sort of system
results.brief_description: Looks at an alternative form of education at the Benedict Community school in New South Wales that is designed to meet the needs of school leavers who are unable to cope with the traditional school system. The course aims to encourage the development of the students as individuals and prepares them for their transition into the workforce.

results.title: Differences
results.creator_credit: John Wright, John Taylor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Differences is a short drama examining the racial conflicts that can occur among children when an “outsider” appears in the midst of a dominant culture. Chris, a pre-adolescent, resents the visit of Emma, a Native girl, to his home. Pressured by his friends to ignore her, by his parents to accept her, and by his own awareness of Emma’s loneliness and unhappiness, Chris must decide where his loyalties lie.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Wright, John Taylor and National Film Board of Canada
